line_1: Free from Confinement, but of Life bereave.
line_2: Till wanton Boys the trembling Wretch relieve,

line_1: So doth it wanton birds of peace bereave,
line_2: So have I seen (who has not, may conceive,)

line_1: Who subt'ly will thy solid Sense bereave,
line_2: And a false Gloss to ev'ry Object give.

line_1: The slanting sun, reluctant to bereave
line_2: WE wish for thee, dear friend! for summer eve

line_1: Of Fancy, Reason, Virtue, nought can me bereave.
line_2: The Woods and Lawns, by living Stream, at Eve:

line_1: Of Fancy, Reason, Virtue, nought can me bereave.
line_2: And I their Toys to the great Children leave;

line_1: But can't our state of pow'r bereave
No pow'r can me of bliss bereave —
line_2: But, William, just as I believe,
